title: Sanitize Hands
description: It is important to sanitize hands to ensure that no germs or bacteria are transferred to the controls or the drone.

title: Helmet with Clear visibility
description: A helmet with clear visibility is essential to ensure that the pilot can see the drone and its surroundings clearly, which is critical to safe and successful drone flying.

title: Weather Forecast Report - Local
description: Checking the local weather forecast is important to ensure that flying conditions are safe and suitable for drone flying. Adverse weather conditions such as high winds, heavy rain or thunderstorms can pose a risk to the drone and the pilot.

title: Flight Plan Sheet
description: A flight plan sheet outlines the route of the drone and any potential hazards or obstacles that may be encountered during the flight. It is important to plan the flight in advance to ensure that it is safe and within the limitations of the drone.

title: Flying Green Zone Check
description: Checking the flying green zone is important to ensure that the drone is not being flown in restricted airspace or in areas that are designated as no-fly zones.

title: RC Battery Check
description: Checking the RC (remote control) battery is important to ensure that it has enough charge to control the drone during the flight. A low or dead battery can cause the drone to crash or become uncontrollable.

title: Drone Battery Check
description: Checking the drone battery is important to ensure that it has enough charge to power the drone during the flight. A low or dead battery can cause the drone to crash or fall out of the sky.

title: Check Wiring Connection
description: Checking the wiring connection is important to ensure that all components of the drone are connected properly and that there are no loose connections.

title: Check CG
description: Checking the CG (center of gravity) is important to ensure that the drone is properly balanced and stable during flight. An improperly balanced drone can cause instability or unexpected movements during flight.

title: Camera Battery Check
description: Checking the camera battery is important to ensure that it has enough charge to record video or capture images during the flight.

title: Mechanical Structure Inspections
description: Inspecting the mechanical structure of the drone is important to ensure that it is in good working condition and that there are no damaged or broken parts that could cause the drone to malfunction or crash.

title: Battery Connection and Power ON Checks
description: Checking the battery connection and powering on the drone is important to ensure that it is ready for flight and that all components are functioning properly.

title: RC Binding Checks
description: Checking the RC binding is important to ensure that the remote control is properly connected to the drone and that it is functioning properly.

title: GCS Connection Check
description: Checking the GCS (ground control station) connection is important to ensure that the pilot can communicate with the drone and receive telemetry data during the flight.

title: Check No propeller Connection
description: Checking that no propellers are connected to the drone is important to prevent accidental propeller rotation, which can cause injury or damage to the drone.

title: Sensor Calibration Checks
description: Whenever travelled a significant distance, do the sensor calibration

title: Telemetry Reception Check
description: Checking telemetry reception is important to ensure that the drone is communicating properly with the ground control station and that telemetry data is being received accurately.

title: RC Channel Mapping Check
description: Check all the RC channels are enabled.

title: Arming Check
description: Checking the arming sequence is important to ensure that the drone is ready to take off and that all components are functioning properly.

title: Dry Run and Motor direction Check
description: Running the drone motors for a short period without taking off is important to ensure that they are spinning in the correct direction and that there are no issues with the motor.

title: Disarming
description: Disarming the drone is important to ensure that it does not take off accidentally or cause injury or damage to the drone.

title: Propeller Connect
description: Connecting the propellers is important to ensure that the drone is ready for takeoff.

title: Connect Nylon (Fishing net) Cable
description: Have a 50 meter of safety cable tied to both the landing gears tied to ground or heavy object

title: Safe Distance Stand
description: Always maintain a safe distance between yourself and the drone while it's in flight. Ensure that you're standing at least 5-10 meters away from the drone, depending on the size and type of the drone.

title: Arming Check
description: Check if the drone is properly armed before taking off. Make sure that the battery is connected and has sufficient charge, propellers are secured, and the drone's GPS system has been calibrated.

title: Run at 20% Throttle for 20 seconds
description: Test the motor functionality by running the drone at 20% throttle for 20 seconds. Ensure that all the motors are working correctly and there are no unusual vibrations or sounds.

title: Kill Switch Check
description: Make sure the Kill Switch in RC is working

title: RTL Check
description: Make sure Return To landing position is locked and can be seen in the display

title: Disarming
description: Make sure to disarm the drone after the test run, or if there is any issue with the drone while flying. Disarming will prevent any accidental movement or damage to the drone.

title: Check Propeller Stability
description: Before takeoff, check the propeller stability and ensure that they are firmly attached and balanced.

title: Arming Check
description: Check again if the drone is properly armed before takeoff. Ensure that all the systems, including battery, propellers, GPS, and other components, are functioning correctly.

title: Position Mode
description: Use position mode for precise flying and control. This mode allows the drone to hold its position in the air and hover accurately, making it easier to control.

title: GPS Fix
description: Ensure that the drone has a proper GPS fix and the signal is strong before flying. GPS is essential for accurate positioning and maintaining the drone's stability in the air.

title: Set the Geo Fence Mode
description: Configure the Geofence to square area of 20 meters. This can be up to 50 meters on need basis

title: Remote Approval
description: This is the remote take off approval from the Ground Control after ensuring all Checklists goes fine.

title: Hover at 5m for 30 seconds
description: Hover the drone at a height of 5 meters for at least 30 seconds to ensure that it is stable and properly balanced.

title: Follow Flight Plan Tests
description: Follow the pre-planned flight route and execute the planned maneuvers carefully. Ensure that the drone is following the path accurately, and the camera or sensors are capturing the required data.

title: Land Safely
description: Land the drone safely after completing the flight plan. Ensure that the drone lands on a flat surface, and the propellers are not touching the ground.

title: Disconnect Battery
description: Disconnect the drone's battery after landing and ensure that all the systems are turned off.

title: Switch off Camera and other support equipment
description: Turn off the camera and other support equipment, if any, after landing the drone.

title: Clear Dust
description: Clean the drone after the flight to remove any dust, debris, or dirt that may have accumulated during the flight.

title: Collect Logs
description: Collect the flight data logs for analysis and future reference. Logs can help identify issues or provide valuable insights for further analysis.

title: Analyze Logs for Issues
description: Analyze the collected logs for any issues, errors, or abnormalities that may have occurred during the flight. It will help to identify any potential problems and improve future flights.

title: Battery Safe Storage
description: Store the batteries in a safe and dry place, away from any heat or flammable materials. Follow the manufacturer's instructions for proper battery storage and disposal.
